channel.title: SecureDrop Journalist Workstation based on Qubes-Whonix
channel.description:
SecureDrop is using Whonix-Qubes:
https://github.com/freedomofpress/securedrop-workstation
Hope someone can document that into our wiki with further testing.
maybe testing as well non-qubes-whonix as well.

item.title: SecureDrop Journalist Workstation based on Qubes-Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
GitHub

freedomofpress/securedrop-workstation

Qubes-based SecureDrop Journalist Workstation environment for submission handling - freedomofpress/securedrop-workstation

SecureDrop

The road towards an integrated SecureDrop Workstation

Through the last year, the Freedom of the Press Foundation (FPF) has sponsored the development of a prototype for an …

SecureDrop

Third party audit of integrated SecureDrop Workstation completed

The SecureDrop team is currently working on an integrated SecureDrop Workstation that combines the previously separate Journalist Workstation and Secure …

SecureDrop

Piloting SecureDrop Workstation for Qubes OS

In March, Freedom of the Press Foundation will begin to pilot SecureDrop Workstation for Qubes OS with select news organizations. The goal of the project is to make the SecureDrop experience more intuitive, and to decrease the time-on-task for...

github.com/freedomofpress/securedrop-workstation

coordination with upstream Whonix

opened 08:51AM - 12 Feb 20 UTC
adrelanos

Is securedrop-workstation deployed live anywhere yet? Reason I am asking, there are significant changes in Whonix testers repository which will then flow...

Read full topic
item.source: SecureDrop Journalist Workstation based on Qubes-Whonix

item.title: SecureDrop Journalist Workstation based on Qubes-Whonix
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi Patick

Patrick:

@TNT_BOM_BOM

Missing the Whonix logo -> https://qubes-os.org/partners/#whonix

Interested in logo pull request?

Visible for me. (Seeing Whonix with Tor networking logo.

Very odd. No Scripts/HTPS Everywhere disabled and log still will not render.

Patrick:

Could you prioritize Update Qubes/Uninstall with new page Reinstall TemplateVM R4.0 please?

Will do. Looking back, this likely contributed to (numerous?) support requests.

Edit: Whonix and Freedom of the Press Foundation are the only 2 logos that will not render on https://qubes-os.org/partners/#whonix

Read full topic
item.source: SecureDrop Journalist Workstation based on Qubes-Whonix

item.title: SecureDrop Journalist Workstation based on Qubes-Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
0brand:

Patrick:

https://securedrop.org/news/road-towards-integrated-securedrop-workstation/ could be mentioned as “others are building on top of Whonix” somewhere. Not for functionality. For project self-description purposes.

We should have a wiki page set up for this purpose. Well respected projects that build/use Whonix.

Not sure we have enough content for that?

Perhaps suitable (multiple possible):

  • https://www.whonix.org
  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Main_Page
  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/About

@TNT_BOM_BOM

Missing the Whonix logo -> https://qubes-os.org/partners/#whonix

Interested in logo pull request?

Visible for me. (Seeing Whonix with Tor networking logo.

0brand TODOs

  • Finish Qubes/DisVMs
  • Need to get moving on staff lounge task
  • Tester Page
  • Qubes Split Tor Browser
  • TNT_BOM_BOM screenshot
  • Update Qubes/Uninstall with new page Reinstall TemplateVM R4.0
  • New wiki page - Well respected projects that build/use Whonix?
  • Reproduce Whonix 13 -> Whonix 14 /var/lib/tor/.tor
  • Miss anything??

Anything that you would like me to do “priority” please let me know.

Could you prioritize Update Qubes/Uninstall with new page Reinstall TemplateVM R4.0 please? Could be huge source for issues. Everything
else is perfect.

Read full topic

https://securedrop.org/news/road-towards-integrated-securedrop-workstation/ could be mentioned as “others are building on top of Whonix” somewhere. Not for functionality. For project self-description purposes.

item.description:
torjunkie:

If these guys use Whonix in the chain for SecureDrop, then that is a solid recommendation we should highlight, yes?

i believe yes.

Read full topic
item.source: SecureDrop Journalist Workstation based on Qubes-Whonix

item.title: SecureDrop Journalist Workstation based on Qubes-Whonix
item.dc:creator: torjunkie
item.description:
Long Wiki Edits Thread

We need to make a page about Mac Hosts similar to Windows Hosts .

Hi TNT_BOM_BOM,

There is a bit of info on the Windows page i.e. MacOS section towards the bottom. I took out the best info from the GNU page and put it there. It could be expanded, but I’m trying to work on other stuff (although short of time at the minute)

Long Wiki Edits Thread

This could use a technical revision

Yes, agreed.

Long Wiki Edits Thread

Added “Spawning DispVMs from other AppVMs” to Qubes/DispVM. This TODO is not complete

Whoops, I removed that TODO too early… Good work you’re doing there

TNT_BOM_BOM:

Hope someone can document that into our wiki with further testing.

I think we should reference that on whichever pages talks about who uses Whonix (or good references page i.e. one where the guy thanks Patrick for firewall rules or similar).

If these guys use Whonix in the chain for SecureDrop, then that is a solid recommendation we should highlight, yes?

Read full topic
item.source: SecureDrop Journalist Workstation based on Qubes-Whonix

item.title: SecureDrop Journalist Workstation based on Qubes-Whonix
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
TNT_BOM_BOM:

Hope someone can document that into our wiki with further testing.

If someone wanted to give it a go it would be great. Might be a good idea to wait a until the bugs/shortcomings are worked out before thinking about adding to wiki.

This project is under active development, has known bugs and shortcomings, and is not ready for end users. This README is geared towards interested technical users and developers.

Read full topic
